product_vision.one_liner: Automated legacy code analysis and migration planning platform powered by Joern
product_vision.value_proposition: Transform weeks of manual legacy code analysis into hours of automated insights, enabling faster and safer migration from C/C++/Pro*C to modern platforms
product_vision.problem_statement: Organizations struggle to migrate legacy C, C++, and Pro*C applications because understanding complex, undocumented codebases requires extensive manual analysis that is time-consuming, error-prone, and lacks scalability
success_metrics: Reduce code analysis time from weeks to hours (90%+ time savings)
Generate actionable migration plans for 100% of analyzed codebases
Enable migration teams to handle 3x more projects simultaneously

primary_persona.name: Migration Architect
primary_persona.description: Senior technical lead responsible for planning and executing legacy system modernization projects
primary_persona.organization_type: Enterprise IT, System Integrators, Consulting Firms

pain_points.description: Manual code analysis takes 2-4 weeks per application, delaying migration timelines
pain_points.current_workaround: Assign multiple engineers to read code manually, create spreadsheets

pain_points.description: Hidden dependencies and side effects discovered late in migration cause rework
pain_points.current_workaround: Extensive testing, manual debugging, iterative fixes

pain_points.description: Pro*C embedded SQL extraction requires specialized expertise that's scarce
Lack of consistent analysis methodology across projects leads to inconsistent quality
pain_points.current_workaround: Create checklists, rely on individual expertise

pain_points.description: Documentation generation from legacy code is manual and often incomplete
pain_points.current_workaround: Reverse engineer docs manually, use limited auto-doc tools

goals: Accelerate migration project timelines by 50% or more
Reduce migration risk by identifying all dependencies upfront
Standardize analysis approach across all migration projects
Enable junior engineers to contribute effectively to migrations
jobs_to_be_done: Understand legacy codebase structure and architecture
Identify all function calls, data flows, and dependencies
Extract database schema and SQL queries from Pro*C code
Map external library dependencies and system calls
Create detailed migration plans with risk assessment
Produce documentation for stakeholders and new team members

secondary_personas.name: Migration Engineer
secondary_personas.description: Software engineer executing migration tasks defined by architects

secondary_personas.name: Project Manager
secondary_personas.description: PM responsible for migration project delivery and stakeholder communication

current_state.maturity_justification: Conceptual migration factory project with no existing implementation. Leverages Joern as foundational technology but requires custom integration and workflow automation

planned: Joern - code analysis engine for C/C++
PostgreSQL - metadata and analysis results storage
React - web-based dashboard and reporting UI
REST API - integration with CI/CD and external tools

alternatives.name: Manual Code Review
strengths: Deep contextual understanding from human expertise
weaknesses: High cost due to labor hours

differentiators.description: Leverages Joern's code property graph for semantic understanding beyond syntax
differentiators.competitive_advantage: Identifies complex dependencies and data flows missed by traditional static analysis

differentiators.description: Built-in extractors for embedded SQL, cursor operations, and Oracle-specific constructs
differentiators.competitive_advantage: Only solution targeting Pro*C migrations specifically

differentiators.description: Every feature designed for migration planning, not just code quality
differentiators.competitive_advantage: Generates actionable migration plans vs. generic quality reports

differentiators.description: End-to-end automation from code ingestion to report generation
differentiators.competitive_advantage: Reduces 2-4 week analysis to hours without manual intervention

differentiators.description: Built on Joern open source, extensible and transparent
differentiators.competitive_advantage: Lower cost, customizable, no vendor lock-in

competitive_context.market_position: Specialized niche tool for C/C++/Pro*C migrations, targeting mid-market and enterprise clients with legacy Oracle/Unix applications needing modernization. Focus on depth (Joern's semantic analysis) over breadth (single language stack).

technical.description: Joern requires JVM and Scala runtime
Joern analysis can be memory-intensive for very large codebases (>1M LOC)
technical.mitigation: Chunking strategies, incremental analysis, cloud scaling

technical.description: Joern C/C++ parser may not support all compiler extensions
technical.impact: Some legacy code may require preprocessing
technical.mitigation: Preprocessor integration, fallback to partial analysis

technical.description: Joern query language (Gremlin/CPG queries) is specialized

resource.description: Requires Joern expertise, legacy C/C++/Pro*C knowledge, migration experience
Target MVP in 3-4 months to validate market fit
resource.mitigation: Focus on core workflow, defer advanced features

resource.description: Need compute resources for Joern processing

business.description: Legacy modernization budgets tied to cloud migration initiatives
business.impact: Must align with cloud migration wave

business.description: Compete with expensive enterprise tools and free manual approaches
business.mitigation: Time savings and risk reduction quantification

business.description: Enterprise clients may require on-premise deployment
business.impact: Must support both cloud and on-prem

assumptions: Target market has significant C/C++/Pro*C legacy applications
Migration teams have budget for tooling (vs. pure manual labor)
Joern capabilities are sufficient for migration analysis needs
Pro*C migrations are moving to modern databases (PostgreSQL, cloud DBs)
limitations: No existing codebase to analyze - discovery based on conceptual requirements
Market sizing estimates would require additional research
User persona validation would benefit from customer interviews
